Title: Built-In Scalar SQL Functions
Description:
The zeroblob(N) function returns a BLOB consisting of N bytes of 0x00.
  SQLite manages these zeroblobs very efficiently.  Zeroblobs can be used to
  reserve space for a BLOB that is later written usingincremental BLOB I/O.
  This SQL function is implemented using thesqlite3_result_zeroblob()routine from the C/C++ interface.
